message.raw:
Fixed many bugs in dragdroptab (perhaps oneday I'll rewrite it with the knowledge I've gained in the last 11 months!)

* Fixed issue where setting the current index (during tab focus restore) was not actually causing the tab to become active
* Switched some event processing to use QCoreApplication.postEvent rather than just calling the function directly
* Fixed the mimeData for our drag event to be custom, so that you can't drag a device tab into the hostname text box of the camera tab (for example)
* Fixed a bug where dragging a device tab (that was the sole tab in a notebook) to another notebook, and back again, would cause the tab to disappear (self.havent_left_source_tab code was being incorrectly reset, and other code was only running if it was False)
* Fixed an issue with incorrect tab label being highlighted (or no tab being highlighted at all)
* Stopped the flickering of the tab label when re-ordering the tab after moving to another notebook.
* Fixed an issue where we weren't re-adding the tab to it's original location if it didn't have a parent notebook unless the drag/drop was rejected by the target. It now doesn't matter if the drag was accepted or rejected by the target, if the dragged tab is in no-mans-land, it should go back to where it started from (hopefully!)
message.html:
Fixed many bugs in dragdroptab (perhaps oneday I'll rewrite it with the knowledge I've gained in the last 11 months!)

  • Fixed issue where setting the current index (during tab focus restore) was not actually causing the tab to become active
  • Switched some event processing to use QCoreApplication.postEvent rather than just calling the function directly
  • Fixed the mimeData for our drag event to be custom, so that you can't drag a device tab into the hostname text box of the camera tab (for example)
  • Fixed a bug where dragging a device tab (that was the sole tab in a notebook) to another notebook, and back again, would cause the tab to disappear (self.havent_left_source_tab code was being incorrectly reset, and other code was only running if it was False)
  • Fixed an issue with incorrect tab label being highlighted (or no tab being highlighted at all)
  • Stopped the flickering of the tab label when re-ordering the tab after moving to another notebook.
  • Fixed an issue where we weren't re-adding the tab to it's original location if it didn't have a parent notebook unless the drag/drop was rejected by the target. It now doesn't matter if the drag was accepted or rejected by the target, if the dragged tab is in no-mans-land, it should go back to where it started from (hopefully!)

message:
Fixed many bugs in dragdroptab (perhaps oneday I'll rewrite it with the knowledge I've gained in the last 11 months!)

* Fixed issue where setting the current index (during tab focus restore) was not actually causing the tab to become active
* Switched some event processing to use QCoreApplication.postEvent rather than just calling the function directly
* Fixed the mimeData for our drag event to be custom, so that you can't drag a device tab into the hostname text box of the camera tab (for example)
* Fixed a bug where dragging a device tab (that was the sole tab in a notebook) to another notebook, and back again, would cause the tab to disappear (self.havent_left_source_tab code was being incorrectly reset, and other code was only running if it was False)
* Fixed an issue with incorrect tab label being highlighted (or no tab being highlighted at all)
* Stopped the flickering of the tab label when re-ordering the tab after moving to another notebook.
* Fixed an issue where we weren't re-adding the tab to it's original location if it didn't have a parent notebook unless the drag/drop was rejected by the target. It now doesn't matter if the drag was accepted or rejected by the target, if the dragged tab is in no-mans-land, it should go back to where it started from (hopefully!)
